criteria: Ability to identify even and odd numbers within a group of up to 20 objects.
Ability to express an even number as a sum of two equal addends (e.g., 6 = 3 + 3).
Ability to write an equation representing the sum of equal addends for even numbers.
descriptions: Student cannot identify even or odd numbers and struggles to group objects.
Student can identify even or odd numbers with significant prompting and struggles to group objects effectively.
Student can identify even or odd numbers with some assistance and can group objects with some errors.
Student can generally identify even or odd numbers and group objects with minor errors.
Student can accurately identify even and odd numbers and group objects effectively with minimal errors.
Student demonstrates a thorough understanding of even and odd numbers, accurately groups objects, and can explain the reasoning behind their groupings.
Student cannot express even numbers as a sum of two equal addends.
Student struggles to express even numbers as a sum of two equal addends even with significant prompting.
Student can express even numbers as a sum of two equal addends with some assistance and may make errors.
Student can generally express even numbers as a sum of two equal addends with minor errors.
Student can accurately express even numbers as a sum of two equal addends with minimal errors.
Student demonstrates a strong understanding of expressing even numbers as a sum of two equal addends, accurately represents numbers, and can explain their reasoning.
Student cannot write an equation to represent the sum of equal addends for even numbers.
Student struggles to write an equation even with significant prompting and assistance.
Student can write an equation with some assistance and may make errors in the equation.
Student can generally write an equation with minor errors.
Student can accurately write an equation with minimal errors.
Student accurately writes equations to represent the sum of equal addends and explains the meaning of the equation clearly.
